channel.title: obgyn on PerceptronMD
channel.description: Recent content in obgyn on PerceptronMD

item.title: Diabetes Mellitus in Pregnancy
item.description: Encounter 1 37yo Hispanic woman G2P1001 at 10w3d comes today for her new OB visit. She is overall doing well but has concerns from her previous pregnancy. Her first pregnancy was complicated by a diagnosis of gestational diabetes mellitus. She worries about this diagnosis for this pregnancy. She wonders how common is GDM and why she had it in her previous pregnancy. How do you counsel her and what are your next steps?

item.title: Premature Rupture of Membranes
item.description: Motivating Example A 26-year-old G2P0101 woman who is 12 weeks pregnant, presents to your prenatal clinic for a new patient visit. Her history is significant vaginal delivery 12 months ago. Beginning at 24 weeks in her previous pregnancy, the patient presented numerous times to Labor and Delivery reporting contractions, and she was sent home each time with a diagnosis of “Braxton-Hicks contractions.” She eventually presented at 28-weeks gestation and was diagnosed with preterm labor.
